page.title: 04Shrewsbury Council Tip.
page.content: The Council Tip at Betton Abbots caters for all of Shrewsbury and Atcham Borough District.It covers 47 acres but they only use 23.A long time ago the Tip was a Kettle Hole which turned into a peat bog with willow trees growing in it.It was taken over by the Council in 1978 and a tractor was soon lost in the bog.It was then dug out by a Dragline. About 100 lorries arrive with rubbish every day.They pay Â£2.76 per ton to an office at the gate.It is squashed by a compactor which is like a bulldozer with spikes on its wheels.The rubbish is buried in layers two metres thick with a thin layer of soil between each. Four people work here full time.They have a shower room and a tea break room. Tomatoes,marrows,corgettes and potatoes grow like weeds here.
